captions.text: Alright. Let's get this shit over with. Come on.
*cheery elevator music*
Have a seat. Don't get too comfortable though. You're never going to see this office ever again.
Oh I'm going to talk as white as I can during this interview *chuckles*
My smile has gotten me through everything in life. So I'm just going to be smiling a lot.
You didn't happen to bring a piece of paper with a surface level description of what you do on it?
I made this in college, and it's just covered in lies.
Here's a template from online. If you could just not read that.
No. Redstone Real Estate does not exist. I saw it on a coffee mug and put it on my resume.
Yeah, I'm not actually reading this. It's just a bullshit formality. *Crunches up paper* Let me start by giving you a vague description of what this job entails.
I'll listen poorly.
Yeah that's gonna help me realize it's never gonna work out.
Now legally I'm not allowed to ask you any questions about age, sex or nationality. But I'm gonna go 'head and make some wild assumptions about you based on your appearance.
As a woman, I wouldn't expect for you to get past the surface level observation.
I'm more concerned with the background check.
I'm gonna try to mold myself into what it is you want me to be.
So tell me. What makes you so damn special?
You know what? I can't think of a damn thing
I'm actually constantly afraid that I'm not special at all.
So when you're not at work, how do you waste your time?
Oh mostly drinking at bars, and hopefully complaining about you in the future.
*chuckes* I'm not listening. Do you have any ill informed questions for me?
I didn't think about this part at all.
How many people here are douchebags like you?
Do you think I got the job?

Well my gut feeling right now is that you have a lot going on on the outside. You are a nightmare to be with in conversation and you're unfortunately still a woman. So you're not going to get the job.
But let's go ahead and press our dirty palms together anyway.
That's fine. I've got two more shitty job interviews to get to today.
Safe to assume I won't hear from you again?
I'm gonna go cry in my car and replay this conversation and tell myself how much of an idiot I am.
Well this was a complete waste of both of our times because I'm just going to hire the boss' nephew anyway. I will literally never think of you ever again.
*cheery elevator music*
Google search. How to get away with sexual harassment.

title: If Everyone Was Honest At Job Interviews

comments.author: TrodeX

comments.text:
As an employer, I can say that I personally do look at a person before 
hiring them in depth. Here's what I want to see in a potential employee
1. Experience, depending on the job
2. Work Ethic
3. Determination and Drive
4. Respect
5. Passion
6. Responsibility
7. Good yet confident (not cocky or arrogant) attitude
8. Reliability
^Notice something here? Outside of experience, say I'm hiring you for a 
welding position I would of course want you to be a welder, its your 
mentality and work ethic thats more important than anything after 
experience. When an employer pops the question "What makes you special" 
rehearse and rehearse again, and say it fast:
I have excellent work ethic, and respectful, reliable, and responsible, and 
am passionate about making a good impression about myself. If I ever need 
to look for another job I want you to be able to vouch for my ethics and 
employ-ability with no if and or buts about who I am."
Use words like "Will, am, absolutely, and affirmative" and never have an 
ounce of doubt in yourself.

-Of course you can simplify it, but boasting confidence and charisma will 
certainly help. Say it with good pace but dont sound like a sped up 
recorder. And if the employer asks if you have any questions for he/she, 
the answer is "When do I begin?" If you set yourself up correctly then that 
will be an appropriate response. Also, keep your poker face.﻿

comments.author: Livy Patchell

comments.text:
15 years ago when I got my first stable job I was in 30 interviews and I 
was honest in all of them.
So you are an engineer but your English stinks.... I had to learn some 
English.
So you are a mechanical engineer.....why don't you have C driving license? 
Now I got B+E and C+E driving license.
So you are an engineer and understand English.....why you were not in the 
Army? What I am going to do with you if the Army will call you? Now I am a 
reservist.
Other stupid quotes:
- you don't have a car. It was an office job...
- Give me 8000$ and the job is yours!
- Come to my house and paint it and I will think about this job.
- how about a date? We were both dudes in the interview :P

At the 31st interview I had enough and I obtain the job.
I wasn't honest!
It was something like this:
Q: Do you know how to make this......?
A: Me? I can be your teacher!
I had no idea what was that.

15 years later I am the one making the interviews and I still remember the 
assholes I had to please in the interviews with naive answers to stupid 
questions.﻿

comments.author: jessica r

comments.text:
My real thoughts:

Interview: why you want to work for us?

Me: to have money so I won't be homeless and because I can't afford for 
rent.

Interview: what are your strengths and disabilities?

Me: I don't know because everybody thinks differently, for me may be good, 
but maybe it's actually bad. 

Interview: how your skills will benefit us? 

Me: you have to hire me so you can know. Because both ways can be a lie 
because I may say something now but when it's moment of truth it might be 
tougher than I thought would be applying my skills here.

Interview: you have job expirience?

Me: no, because when I was younger I thought focusing more on my studies is 
more important than job expirience, because i thought I would be hire 
because of education and not experience. Also my college didn't told me the 
existence of internship until I was finishing my last semester. But if I 
work at Burger King for few months, would that help as expirience as 
programmer? Because all programming jobs ask expirience and I don't have 
any since I must have expirience to gain expirience, which it's silly for 
me, even for an entry level position, even a nooby position needs at least 
3 years expirience. To be sincere if you hire a none expirience I'll work 
like you want me to work and never go against your working believe cuz I'm 
used to my expiriences. 

Interview: what do you expect from us?

Me: besides money so I won't be homeless? You offering me training before 
hand so I can know what I am doing and not look like a hot mess on first 
few weeks or someone to teach me once and then see me do it, then correct 
me if wrong.
﻿
